basics.name: Eidrene Glena C. Estebal
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: A computer scientist passionate about cybersecurity, network architecture, and the pursuit of secure digital systems.

work.name: Nexus Technologies Inc.
work.summary: Assisted in assessing client security systems by monitoring and analyzing potential threats, performing digital forensics, and compiling indicators of compromise and attack. Conducted passive reconnaissance and reputation research on IPs using OSINT tools to support threat intelligence. Developed usage guidelines and presented best practices for leveraging forensic tools such as KAPE, FTK Imager, and AIM for efficient triaging.

volunteer.summary: Volunteered in a large-scale malware detection initiative to mitigate risks within the school network after a security breach. Implemented scanning tools and preventive protocols to identify and contain infected systems. Contributed to strengthening the institution’s overall cybersecurity posture and digital resilience.

education.area: Computer Science with Specialization in Network and Information Security

references.name: Gregory G. Cu
references.reference:
College of Computer Studies
De La Salle University – Manila

projects.name: Implementation and Testing of SWeeT Protocol on an ESP32
projects.summary: This study tests the SWeeT Protocol on an ESP32 for securing telehealth data using PUF-based keys and XOR encryption.
